result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Lee Dixon

records.addlTxt: Marathon County Victim Waiver of No Contact Bond Condition- S.C.

Pre-trial conference on December 13, 2022 at 11:05 am.
Final pre-trial on March 6, 2023 at 03:10 pm.
Jury status hearing on April 17, 2023 at 10:10 am.
Jury Trial on June 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Includes cases 22CT338 & 22CM1045. No contact with victim(s): S.M.C. or residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. No driving without a valid license. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amanda.
Cases called at 2:20 pm. 
INCLUDES: 22CT338 and 22CM1045.

State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. Defendant appears from MCJ, with Attorney Greg Venturini.
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA: NOT GUILTY. 

COURT ORDERS: $750 sig bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): S.M.C., or residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of alcohol. 
- No driving without a valid license. 
- Level 2.
